page.title: 14SPECIAL FEATURES.
page.content: Outside the Post Office is the {Sheringham town sign.}It was erected to commemorate the Silver Jubilee of the Queen. It is carved in iroco wood and has a shield with two pine cones and below them is a ship in full sail. The Latin inscription translates as "Both sea and pines adorn it". Every year the town has a{Carnival}and it also has a{Raft Race}from the beach to Cromer. {The Salvation Army}organises visits of very fine musicians and bands often. {The Little Theatre}arranges a wide programme of events - plays by local groups, quizzes, concerts, films, talent shows and a summer repertory. The town has a{brass band}and a{Music {School}which meets on Saturday. Each year the infants have an{Easter {Bonnet Parade}around the town which is very popular.
